Title: Cheesy air fryer tortilla quiche
Description: This air fryer tortilla quiche is a genius hack for a quick and delicious breakfast or brunch. With eggs, veggies, and cheese baked in tortillas, it's the perfect combo of convenience and flavor. Use your air fryer for a crispy outside and a creamy inside. The great thing about this recipe is that you can easily customize it to your liking: Add cooked bacon, sausage, or ham for a meatier version, or swap the veggies for what you have on hand, like bell peppers, mushrooms, or tomatoes. Make sure to press down the tortillas well into the muffin molds so they hold their shape. If you don't have an air fryer, you can also bake these in a regular oven at 180¬∞C/350¬∞F for approx. 15‚Äì18 min.
Ingredients: 4 small tortilla wraps, 4 eggs, 100g baby spinach, 1 scallion, 60g feta cheese, 80g shredded mozzarella, salt, pepper
Steps: 1. Beat eggs with salt and pepper. Finely chop spinach and scallion, crumble feta. Mix into eggs with mozzarella. 2. Press tortillas into air fryer muffin molds. Divide egg mixture among tortilla cups. 3. Air fry at 180¬∞C/350¬∞F for 10 min until set and golden. Let cool slightly before removing.
Tags: marinating, side, breakfast, vegetarian, main, cheese, prepare ahead, eggs, brunch, savory, for four, dairy, vegetables, spring, autumn, summer, winter, air fryer

Title: Creamy white bean dip with herb oil
Description: Forget hummus, because white bean dip is about to be your new favorite! Silky, creamy, and downright addictive, this dip is the perfect companion for crunchy veggies, pita chips, or a simple slice of sourdough. What sets this dip apart is its lush texture from the cannellini beans and the herby, garlicky oil drizzle that takes it to the next level. You can make this dip in under 10 minutes, which makes it perfect for spontaneous gatherings or when you simply want a quick, wholesome snack. Swap the herbs to whatever you like ‚Äì basil, cilantro, or even mint will work beautifully. Want to make it extra rich? Stir in a spoonful of tahini or Greek yogurt. The dip can be stored in the fridge for up to 3 days and tastes even better the next day when the flavors have melded together.
Ingredients: 400g canned white beans, 2 cloves garlic, 3 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 10g parsley, 5g dill, salt, pepper, chili flakes (optional)
Steps: 1. Drain and rinse white beans. Peel garlic. 2. Blend beans, 1 clove garlic, 2 tbsp olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper until smooth. 3. Finely chop herbs and remaining garlic. Mix with remaining olive oil and chili flakes. 4. Transfer dip to serving bowl, drizzle herb oil on top and serve.
Tags: side, vegetarian, dip, vegan, main, prepare ahead, veganuary, lactose free, gluten free, brunch, spices, Meatless, light, savory, dairy, herbs, vegetables, spring, autumn, summer, winter

Title: Hungarian lecso
Description: This recipe is one of the most famous in Hungary. It is similar to ratatouille. During my last trip to Hungary, I had the pleasure of trying the local Lecso and I was simply amazed. We usually use very small green peppers there. Optionally you can add smoked sausages (called Kolb√°sz) or you can fry eggs in it if you would like to make a vegetarian version. Perfect to serve on a slice of bread for a light dinner!
Ingredients: 1 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 400g tomatoes, 3 bell peppers, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp sugar, salt, pepper, bread (for serving)
Steps: 1. Dice onion and chop garlic. Cut tomatoes and peppers into chunks. 2. Heat oil in a pan, saut√© onion until translucent. Add garlic and paprika, cook briefly. 3. Add peppers, cook for 10 min. Add tomatoes, sugar, salt, pepper. 4. Simmer for 20 min until thickened. Serve with bread.
Tags: weeknight dinner, vegetarian, salty, vegan, side, main, veganuary, lactose free, gluten free, comfort food, Hungarian, spices, Meatless, light, savory, vegetables, spring, autumn, summer, sauteing

Title: French toasted bagel with strawberries and pistachios
Description: Tired of the same old French toast? It's time to upgrade with this bagel version that's crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and perfect for soaking up all that eggy, cinnamon goodness. What makes this recipe special is the combination of textures and flavors: The chewy bagel, the creamy mascarpone, the juicy strawberries, and the crunchy pistachios create a harmony that's simply irresistible. You can easily customize this recipe by swapping strawberries for other berries or even caramelized bananas. If you don't have mascarpone, cream cheese or ricotta work just as well. For an extra indulgent touch, drizzle some maple syrup or honey on top right before serving. This French toasted bagel is perfect for a leisurely weekend breakfast or brunch, and it's fancy enough to impress guests but simple enough to whip up on a lazy Sunday morning.
Ingredients: 2 bagels, 2 eggs, 100ml milk, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 150g strawberries, 30g pistachios, 100g mascarpone, 2 tbsp butter, maple syrup (for serving)
Steps: 1. Halve bagels. Whisk eggs, milk, cinnamon and vanilla. 2. Slice strawberries and chop pistachios. 3. Dip bagel halves in egg mixture. Melt butter in pan and fry bagels until golden on both sides. 4. Spread mascarpone on bagels, top with strawberries and pistachios. Drizzle with maple syrup.
Tags: side, breakfast, vegetarian, nuts, main, eggs, brunch, fruits, for two, frying, dairy, spring, summer

Title: Red cabbage hash browns with kale and garlic mushrooms
Description: If you've never had red cabbage hash browns, you're in for a treat. These beauties are crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and absolutely bursting with flavor. Red cabbage might seem like an unusual choice for hash browns, but once you try it, there's no going back. The natural sweetness of the cabbage caramelizes beautifully, and when paired with earthy kale and umami-packed garlic mushrooms, this becomes a meal you'll want to make again and again. I love serving these for brunch, but they also make an excellent light dinner. You can easily customize the recipe by adding a fried egg on top or sprinkling some crumbled feta over the mushrooms for a tangy kick. If you're meal-prepping, the hash browns reheat wonderfully in a pan or air fryer, getting crispy all over again. Pro tip: Don't skip the step of squeezing out excess moisture from the cabbage ‚Äì that's the secret to achieving that perfect golden crust!
Ingredients: 300g red cabbage, 150g potatoes, 1 egg, 2 tbsp flour, 200g mushrooms, 100g kale, 3 cloves garlic, 4 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper, sour cream (for serving)
Steps: 1. Grate red cabbage and potatoes. Squeeze out excess moisture. Mix with egg, flour, salt and pepper. 2. Heat 2 tbsp oil in pan. Form cabbage mixture into patties and fry until golden and crispy on both sides. 3. Slice mushrooms, chop kale and garlic. Heat remaining oil, saut√© garlic briefly. Add mushrooms and kale, cook until tender. Season with salt and pepper. 4. Serve hash browns topped with mushroom-kale mixture and sour cream.
Tags: weeknight dinner, vegetarian, side, main, prepare ahead, comfort food, brunch, Meatless, savory, for two, frying, eggs, dairy, herbs, vegetables, autumn, winter

Title: Hearty barley risotto with mushrooms and thyme
Description: If you think risotto can only be made with rice, this hearty barley version will change your mind! Swapping Arborio rice for barley gives this dish a wonderfully nutty flavor and a satisfying, chewy texture that feels even more comforting. Plus, barley is packed with fiber and nutrients, making this risotto as wholesome as it is delicious. The earthy mushrooms and fragrant thyme add layers of flavor that make every bite feel like a warm hug. This recipe is perfect for a cozy dinner at home, especially during the colder months. You can easily customize it by adding other vegetables like peas, spinach, or roasted butternut squash. For a vegan version, simply skip the Parmesan or use a plant-based alternative. The key to a great risotto is patience ‚Äì stir frequently and add the broth gradually to let the barley release its starches and create that signature creamy texture. Serve it with a crisp green salad and a glass of white wine for the ultimate comfort meal.
Ingredients: 200g pearl barley, 300g mushrooms, 1 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 4 sprigs thyme, 1L vegetable stock, 100ml white wine, 50g Parmesan cheese, 2 tbsp butter, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Steps: 1. Dice onion and chop garlic. Slice mushrooms. Strip thyme leaves. 2. Heat olive oil in large pan, saut√© onion until translucent. Add garlic and mushrooms, cook until browned. 3. Add barley and thyme, toast briefly. Add wine and cook until absorbed. 4. Gradually add hot stock, stirring frequently, until barley is tender and creamy (35-40 min). 5. Stir in butter and Parmesan. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
Tags: weeknight dinner, vegetarian, main, comfort food, alcohol, Meatless, savory, for four, grains, dairy, herbs, vegetables, autumn, winter

Title: Paprika chicken thighs with roasted vegetables
Description: Paprika chicken thighs with roasted vegetables is your new go-to dinner for busy weeknights. Everything roasts together on one sheet pan, meaning minimal cleanup and maximum flavor. The chicken thighs get wonderfully crispy on the outside while staying juicy inside, thanks to the paprika rub that adds a smoky, slightly sweet kick. The vegetables caramelize beautifully, soaking up all those delicious chicken juices. You can easily swap the vegetables based on what you have on hand ‚Äì try adding bell peppers, zucchini, or even sweet potatoes. For a spicier version, add a pinch of cayenne pepper to the paprika mix. If you want to prep ahead, you can marinate the chicken in the spice rub overnight for even more intense flavor. Serve this with crusty bread, rice, or a simple green salad for a complete meal. Leftovers (if there are any!) make fantastic sandwiches or salads the next day.
Ingredients: 8 chicken thighs, 2 bell peppers, 2 zucchini, 1 red onion, 2 tbsp paprika, 1 tsp garlic powder, 4 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper, fresh herbs (for serving)
Steps: 1. Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F. Mix paprika, garlic powder, salt, pepper and 2 tbsp olive oil. Rub onto chicken thighs. 2. Cut peppers, zucchini and onion into chunks. Toss with remaining olive oil, salt and pepper. 3. Arrange chicken and vegetables on baking sheet. 4. Roast for 35 min until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender. Garnish with fresh herbs.
Tags: roasting, weeknight dinner, salty, spicy, main, comfort food, poultry, chicken, spices, savory, for four, vegetables, spring, autumn, summer, winter, oven

Title: Creamy one-pot French onion pasta
Description: Imagine all the flavors of French onion soup but in a comforting, creamy pasta form ‚Äì that's what you get with this one-pot wonder! The secret is slowly caramelizing the onions until they're sweet, jammy, and deeply flavorful. Combined with tender pasta, a splash of wine, and a generous helping of Gruy√®re cheese, this dish is pure comfort food magic. The best part? Everything cooks in one pot, which means less cleanup and more time to enjoy your meal. This recipe is perfect for a cozy night in, especially during the fall and winter months. You can customize it by adding mushrooms, fresh thyme, or even a handful of spinach at the end. For an extra indulgent touch, top it with crispy fried onions or a drizzle of truffle oil. The key to success here is patience ‚Äì don't rush the caramelization process, as that's where all the magic happens. Serve with a simple green salad and a glass of the same wine you used for cooking.
Ingredients: 3 large onions, 3 cloves garlic, 350g pasta, 100ml white wine, 500ml vegetable stock, 200ml heavy cream, 150g Gruy√®re cheese, 3 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp flour, salt, pepper, fresh thyme (for garnish)
Steps: 1. Thinly slice onions and chop garlic. Melt butter in large pot, add onions and cook slowly for 25-30 min until caramelized. 2. Add garlic and flour, cook for 1 min. Add wine and cook until reduced. 3. Add stock and pasta, bring to boil. Cook until pasta is al dente, stirring occasionally. 4. Stir in cream and grated Gruy√®re until melted. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh thyme.
Tags: weeknight dinner, main, cheese, pasta, comfort food, alcohol, french, savory, for four, dairy, herbs, winter, autumn

Title: Whole roasted broccoli with bean hummus and sumac butter
Description: Forget everything you know about boring broccoli ‚Äì this whole roasted version is a showstopper! Roasting the broccoli whole creates an incredible contrast of textures: crispy, charred florets on the outside and tender, almost creamy stems on the inside. The bean hummus adds a creamy, protein-packed base, while the sumac butter brings a tangy, citrusy note that ties everything together beautifully. This dish is perfect as a vegetarian main course or as a stunning side dish for dinner parties. You can easily swap the white bean hummus for chickpea hummus or even a tahini sauce. If you can't find sumac, lemon zest mixed into the butter works wonderfully as well. For extra flavor, try marinating the broccoli in olive oil, garlic, and lemon juice for 30 minutes before roasting. This recipe proves that vegetables can absolutely be the star of the show ‚Äì and your guests will be asking for seconds!
Ingredients: 1 large broccoli, 400g white beans, 2 tbsp tahini, 2 cloves garlic, juice of 1 lemon, 50g butter, 1 tsp sumac, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Steps: 1. Preheat oven to 220¬∞C/425¬∞F. Trim broccoli stem, brush with olive oil, season with salt and pepper. 2. Roast broccoli for 20-25 min until charred and tender. 3. Meanwhile, blend white beans, tahini, garlic, lemon juice, salt and pepper until smooth. Add water if needed. 4. Melt butter and stir in sumac. 5. Spread hummus on serving plate, place roasted broccoli on top, drizzle with sumac butter.
Tags: roasting, vegetarian, side, main, Meatless, light, savory, for two, dairy, vegetables, spring, autumn, summer, winter, oven

Title: Mediterranean cabbage rolls with lentil zucchini filling
Description: Cabbage rolls get a Mediterranean makeover in this fresh, flavorful recipe! Instead of the traditional meat filling, these rolls are packed with protein-rich lentils, tender zucchini, and aromatic herbs that transport you straight to the sunny shores of Greece or Italy. The cabbage leaves become wonderfully tender as they bake in a rich tomato sauce, soaking up all those delicious flavors. This recipe is perfect for meal prep ‚Äì you can make a big batch and freeze them for easy weeknight dinners. They also taste even better the next day when the flavors have had time to meld. You can customize the filling by adding mushrooms, spinach, or even some crumbled feta for extra richness. If you want to save time, you can use pre-cooked lentils from a can. These cabbage rolls are not only delicious but also incredibly wholesome and satisfying ‚Äì proof that plant-based meals can be just as comforting as their meaty counterparts. Serve with crusty bread and a simple side salad for a complete meal.
Ingredients: 1 large cabbage, 200g lentils, 2 zucchini, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 400g canned tomatoes, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 100ml vegetable stock, 1 tsp oregano, 1 tsp basil, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Steps: 1. Cook lentils according to package instructions. Remove 8-10 large cabbage leaves, blanch in boiling water for 3 min. 2. Dice zucchini, onion and garlic. Saut√© in olive oil until soft. Mix with cooked lentils, half the herbs, salt and pepper. 3. Place filling on cabbage leaves and roll up, tucking in sides. 4. Mix tomatoes, tomato paste, stock and remaining herbs. Pour half into baking dish, arrange cabbage rolls on top, pour remaining sauce over. 5. Cover and bake at 180¬∞C/350¬∞F for 35 min.
Tags: baking, middle eastern, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, main, prepare ahead, comfort food, Meatless, savory, for four, grains, herbs, vegetables, autumn, winter, oven

Title: Pumpkin pie overnight oats
Description: Start your morning with the cozy flavors of pumpkin pie ‚Äì no baking required! These overnight oats taste like dessert but are actually a wholesome, nourishing breakfast that will keep you full until lunch. The pumpkin pur√©e adds natural sweetness and creaminess, while the warm spices like cinnamon, ginger, and nutmeg make every spoonful feel like a warm hug. The beauty of overnight oats is that you can prep them the night before, and breakfast is ready when you wake up ‚Äì perfect for busy mornings. You can easily customize this recipe by adding your favorite toppings: try chopped pecans, a drizzle of maple syrup, a dollop of Greek yogurt, or even some chocolate chips if you're feeling indulgent. If you don't have pumpkin pur√©e, mashed sweet potato or butternut squash work wonderfully too. These oats are not only delicious but also packed with fiber, protein, and nutrients to fuel your day. They'll keep in the fridge for up to 3 days, making them perfect for meal prep!
Ingredients: 100g oats, 250ml milk, 100g pumpkin pur√©e, 2 tbsp maple syrup, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp ginger, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, pinch of salt, toppings: pecans, yogurt, maple syrup
Steps: 1. Mix oats, milk, pumpkin pur√©e, maple syrup, spices and salt in jar or container. 2. Cover and refrigerate overnight or at least 4 hours. 3. In morning, stir well and add more milk if needed. Top with pecans, yogurt and maple syrup.
Tags: breakfast, vegetarian, sweet, prepare ahead, comfort food, brunch, american, for two, grains, dairy, autumn, winter

Title: Juicy Shirazi Salad (Persian Salad)
Description: This Persian Shirazi salad is a burst of freshness in every bite! Originating from the city of Shiraz in Iran, this simple yet vibrant salad combines crisp cucumbers, juicy tomatoes, and crunchy onions with a zesty lime dressing. It's light, refreshing, and incredibly addictive ‚Äì you'll find yourself making it again and again, especially during the hot summer months. What makes this salad special is its simplicity: just a handful of fresh ingredients, but the result is so much more than the sum of its parts. The key is to chop everything very finely and let the salad sit for about 10 minutes before serving, allowing the flavors to meld together beautifully. You can easily customize this by adding fresh mint, dill, or even some pomegranate seeds for a pop of color and sweetness. This salad is traditionally served alongside kebabs and rice, but it also makes a fantastic side for grilled meats, fish, or as a topping for flatbreads and wraps. It's vegan, gluten-free, and ready in under 20 minutes ‚Äì what's not to love?
Ingredients: 3 large tomatoes, 2 cucumbers, 1 red onion, juice of 2 limes, 3 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp dried mint, salt, pepper
Steps: 1. Dice tomatoes, cucumbers and onion into very small cubes. 2. Mix with lime juice, olive oil, dried mint, salt and pepper. 3. Let sit for 10 min before serving to allow flavors to blend.
Tags: middle eastern, side, salad, vegan, gluten free, Meatless, light, Persian, savory, for four, vegetables, spring, summer

Title: Creamy roasted red pepper soup
Description: This roasted red pepper soup is like sunshine in a bowl ‚Äì vibrant, warming, and utterly delicious! Roasting the peppers brings out their natural sweetness and adds a subtle smoky depth that makes this soup incredibly satisfying. The creamy texture comes from blending the roasted vegetables with a touch of cream, creating a velvety smooth soup that feels indulgent but is actually quite light. This recipe is perfect for meal prep ‚Äì it freezes beautifully and tastes even better the next day. You can easily make it vegan by using coconut cream instead of dairy cream. For extra flavor, try adding a pinch of smoked paprika or a swirl of pesto on top before serving. If you want to add some protein, a handful of cooked chickpeas or white beans stirred in at the end works wonderfully. This soup pairs perfectly with crusty bread or a grilled cheese sandwich for a cozy, comforting meal. It's also elegant enough to serve as a starter for dinner parties ‚Äì just garnish with fresh basil and a drizzle of good olive oil.
Ingredients: 4 red bell peppers, 2 tomatoes, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 500ml vegetable stock, 100ml heavy cream, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp paprika, salt, pepper, fresh basil (for garnish)
Steps: 1. Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F. Halve peppers and remove seeds. Place peppers, tomatoes, onion quarters and garlic on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. 2. Roast for 25-30 min until charred and soft. 3. Transfer to blender, add stock, paprika and blend until smooth. 4. Pour into pot, stir in cream, heat through. Season with salt and pepper. 5. Serve garnished with fresh basil and a drizzle of olive oil.
Tags: roasting, vegetarian, salty, side, soup, main, gluten free, comfort food, Meatless, savory, for four, dairy, herbs, vegetables, autumn, winter, oven

Title: Baked eggs in tomato sauce (Shakshuka)
Description: Shakshuka is the ultimate comfort food ‚Äì a one-pan wonder that's perfect for breakfast, brunch, lunch, or even dinner! This Middle Eastern dish features eggs poached in a rich, spicy tomato sauce loaded with bell peppers and onions. It's warming, satisfying, and incredibly flavorful. The best part? It looks impressive but is actually super easy to make. The key to a great shakshuka is building layers of flavor: saut√©ing the vegetables until soft and sweet, adding plenty of spices like cumin and paprika, and letting the tomato sauce simmer until thick and rich. Then you just crack the eggs right into the sauce and let them cook until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny ‚Äì perfect for dipping bread into! You can customize this recipe by adding spinach, chickpeas, or crumbled feta on top. For extra heat, add some harissa or fresh chili. This dish is traditionally served family-style straight from the pan with lots of crusty bread for scooping. It's perfect for a lazy weekend brunch or a quick weeknight dinner.
Ingredients: 4 eggs, 1 onion, 2 bell peppers, 3 cloves garlic, 400g canned tomatoes, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp chili flakes, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper, fresh parsley, bread (for serving)
Steps: 1. Dice onion, peppers and garlic. Heat olive oil in large pan, saut√© onion and peppers until soft. 2. Add garlic, cumin, paprika and chili, cook for 1 min. 3. Add tomatoes, season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 15 min until thickened. 4. Make 4 wells in sauce and crack eggs into them. Cover and cook until whites are set but yolks still runny. 5. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve with bread.
Tags: middle eastern, breakfast, vegetarian, salty, spicy, main, eggs, gluten free, brunch, spices, Meatless, savory, for two, dairy, herbs, vegetables, spring, autumn, summer, winter

Title: Crispy coconut tofu with sweet chili sauce
Description: If you think tofu is bland, this crispy coconut version will change your mind forever! The secret is coating the tofu in a mixture of coconut flakes and panko breadcrumbs, then baking (or frying) until golden and crunchy. The result is a texture that's crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, with a subtle sweetness from the coconut that pairs perfectly with the tangy-sweet chili sauce. This recipe is perfect for converting tofu skeptics ‚Äì the coating is so delicious that even meat lovers will be impressed. You can easily make this gluten-free by using gluten-free breadcrumbs, and it's already vegan-friendly. The sweet chili sauce can be store-bought or homemade ‚Äì try adding fresh ginger and lime juice to take it to the next level. Serve this as an appetizer, add it to salads or rice bowls, or make it the star of a meal with some steamed rice and stir-fried vegetables. The tofu can also be made in an air fryer for an even healthier version ‚Äì just spray with a little oil and cook at 200¬∞C/400¬∞F for 15 minutes, flipping halfway through.
Ingredients: 400g firm tofu, 50g shredded coconut, 50g panko breadcrumbs, 2 eggs, 3 tbsp flour, 100ml sweet chili sauce, vegetable oil (for frying), salt, pepper
Steps: 1. Press tofu to remove excess water, cut into cubes. 2. Set up breading station: flour in one bowl, beaten eggs in another, coconut and panko mixed in third bowl. 3. Coat tofu in flour, then egg, then coconut mixture. 4. Heat oil in pan and fry tofu until golden and crispy on all sides. Or bake at 200¬∞C/400¬∞F for 25 min. 5. Serve with sweet chili sauce for dipping.
Tags: Asian, vegan, salty, sweet, main, veganuary, lactose free, comfort food, spices, Meatless, savory, for two, soy products, frying, spring, autumn, summer, winter

Title: Spicy Korean gochujang noodles
Description: These Korean-inspired noodles are packed with flavor and come together in less than 20 minutes ‚Äì perfect for when you're craving something spicy, savory, and totally satisfying! The star of this dish is gochujang, a fermented Korean chili paste that brings a unique combination of heat, sweetness, and umami depth. Mixed with soy sauce, sesame oil, and a touch of honey, it creates a sauce that clings beautifully to the noodles and will have you going back for seconds (and thirds!). You can customize this recipe based on what you have in your fridge ‚Äì add vegetables like bok choy, mushrooms, or bell peppers, or top with a fried egg for extra richness. For protein, try adding crispy tofu, edamame, or leftover cooked chicken. If you can't find gochujang, you can substitute with sriracha or another chili paste, though the flavor will be slightly different. These noodles are perfect for a quick lunch or dinner, and they also make great meal prep ‚Äì just store the noodles and sauce separately and combine when ready to eat.
Ingredients: 200g noodles, 2 tbsp gochujang, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1 tbsp honey, 2 cloves garlic, 2 scallions, 1 tbsp sesame seeds, 1 tsp rice vinegar
Steps: 1. Cook noodles according to package instructions, drain and set aside. 2. Mix gochujang, soy sauce, sesame oil, honey and rice vinegar. Chop garlic and scallions. 3. Heat pan, add garlic and cook briefly. Add sauce and noodles, toss to coat. 4. Serve topped with scallions and sesame seeds.
Tags: Asian, Korean, weeknight dinner, vegan, salty, spicy, main, pasta, veganuary, lactose free, spices, Meatless, savory, for two, spring, autumn, summer, winter

Title: Turkish candied pumpkin (Kabak tatlƒ±sƒ±)
Description: This traditional Turkish dessert turns humble pumpkin into something magical! Kabak tatlƒ±sƒ± is a beloved sweet treat in Turkey, where pieces of pumpkin are slowly cooked with sugar until they become translucent, tender, and wonderfully sweet. The result is unlike anything else ‚Äì the pumpkin develops an almost caramelized, honey-like flavor that's absolutely divine. What makes this dessert special is its simplicity and the way it celebrates the natural sweetness of pumpkin. Traditionally served with tahini or kaymak (clotted cream) and crushed walnuts, it's a study in contrasts: the sweet pumpkin against the slightly bitter tahini and the crunchy nuts. This dessert is naturally vegan and gluten-free (just skip the cream), and it's much lighter than typical Western desserts. You can make it ahead of time ‚Äì it actually tastes better after sitting for a day as the flavors develop. It's best served at room temperature or slightly chilled. If you can't find kaymak, Greek yogurt or whipped cream work beautifully as substitutes.
Ingredients: 1kg pumpkin, 400g sugar, 100ml water, 50g walnuts, 2 tbsp tahini, kaymak or clotted cream (for serving)
Steps: 1. Peel pumpkin and cut into large chunks (about 8cm pieces). 2. Arrange pumpkin in single layer in large pot. Sprinkle sugar over and add water. 3. Cover and cook on low heat for 60-90 min until pumpkin is translucent and very tender. Let cool in syrup. 4. Chop walnuts. Serve pumpkin with tahini, kaymak and crushed walnuts.
Tags: Turkish, middle eastern, dessert, vegetarian, sweet, prepare ahead, comfort food, nuts, for four, autumn, winter

Title: Crispy potato galette with smoked salmon
Description: Fresh from the oven, straight onto your plate: this potato galette with crispy edges is just what you need right now! Enjoy crispy, soft and creamy textures all in one dish ‚Äì and you won't be craving anything more for the rest of the day. The cr√®me fra√Æche and potato base will fill you up no problem, while the smoked salmon will elevate the taste to a party along with those fresh herbs. Trust that this dish is best served out of the oven with the potato edges extra crispy, so even if you prepare it ahead, do the baking last: Layer the potatoes in a pan and let them rest, and only bake before you serve. Need to reheat? Remove the salmon, heat the potato base up, and add salmon back after.
Ingredients: 1.25kg waxy potatoes, 80g butter, 1 clove garlic, 100g Parmesan cheese, 120g cr√®me fra√Æche, 15g dill, 1/2 lemon, 225g smoked salmon, 1 red onion, 30g capers, 10g chives, salt, pepper
Steps: 1. Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/392¬∞F. Slice potatoes thinly. Melt butter with chopped garlic. Mix with potatoes, season well. 2. Arrange potatoes in overlapping circles in cast iron pan, sprinkling Parmesan between layers. 3. Bake for 60-80 min until golden and crispy. Meanwhile, dice onion, chop herbs, drain capers. Mix cr√®me fra√Æche with dill, lemon zest and juice. Slice salmon. 4. After baking, transfer galette to platter. Spread cr√®me fra√Æche mix on top, garnish with salmon, onion, capers and chives.
Tags: baking, roasting, side, salty, main, cheese, prepare ahead, comfort food, fish, dinner party, french, european, savory, nordic, dairy, herbs, vegetables, spring, autumn, summer, winter

Title: Flavorful carrot salad with crispy Beluga lentils
Description: This carrot salad with crispy Beluga lentils really has it all: It's packed with textures and flavors, and it's both filling and light as a satisfying main. The combination of crunchy carrot ribbons, sweet dried apricots and earthy hazelnuts make the whole plate particularly exciting. Ras el Hanout gives the salad a warm, spicy note, while lemon zest, sherry vinegar and parsley provide freshness and lightness. For me, the roasted lentils are an absolute highlight, giving the salad a great crunch, completing the perfect celebration of different flavours and textures. You can swap the dried apricots for fresh ones, add other herbs like dill, or roast other nuts like almonds. If you like, sprinkle some feta on top at the end for a creamy component; without it, the dish is completely vegan. A colorful, healthy and satisfying salad, ideal for brunch, lunch or as part of your next dinner.
Ingredients: 250g beluga lentils, 400g carrots, 8 tbsp olive oil, 1 red onion, 8 dried apricots, 60g hazelnuts, 20g parsley, 2 tsp ras el hanout, 2 tsp maple syrup, 1 tsp lemon zest, 3 tbsp sherry vinegar, chili (optional), salt, pepper
Steps: 1. Preheat oven to 220¬∞C/425¬∞F. Cook lentils, drain, spread on baking sheet with 2 tbsp olive oil. Roast for 15 min until crispy. 2. Peel carrots into ribbons. Slice onion into rings. Cut apricots into strips. Add to serving bowl. Chop hazelnuts and parsley. 3. Heat remaining olive oil with hazelnuts and ras el hanout. Pour over salad. Add maple syrup, lemon zest and sherry vinegar. Season and toss. 4. Add roasted lentils and parsley. Toss again, adjust seasoning. Garnish with chili if desired.
Tags: middle eastern, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, vegan, superfood, side, salad, nuts, dried-fruits, main, gluten free, dinner party, brunch, spices, Meatless, light, savory, grains, herbs, vegetables, spring, autumn, summer, winter, oven

Title: Fried pumpkin and chorizo pasta
Description: Fall season is all about being cozy, and nothing is cozier than seeing your orecchiette pasta hugging fried pumpkin pieces and chorizo pieces on your plate. This pasta belongs to autumn just as much as colorful leaves and long walks on crisp days. It's not only super easy, but also is an absolute flavor maze. You'll encounter a different flavor at every turn: Chorizo pieces that bring a bold and spicy flavor, the fried pumpkins with that smoky-sweet and silky creaminess, or the earthy thyme bringing it all together, it's all yours to try! For a fresher note, go for a little lemon zest right before serving and if you can't find fresh chorizo, simply swap for dried chorizo!
Ingredients: 200g Hokkaido pumpkins, 1 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp olive oil, 150g chorizo, 3 sprigs thyme, 200g chicken stock, 250g orecchiette, 50g Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper
Steps: 1. Dice onion, chop garlic, dice pumpkin. Drain chickpeas. Heat olive oil, sear chorizo until browned. Remove from pan. 2. Add more oil, saut√© onion until translucent. Add garlic and thyme, cook 1 min. Add pumpkin and chorizo, stir-fry 3 min. Add broth, simmer with lid until pumpkin soft. 3. Cook pasta until al dente minus 2 min. Add pasta and pasta water to pan, boil 2 min until creamy. Season and stir in Parmesan. Garnish with thyme and Parmesan.
Tags: italian, roasting, weeknight dinner, salty, spicy, main, cheese, pasta, comfort food, pork, sausage, savory, for two, dairy, herbs, vegetables, autumn, sauteing

Title: Easy tempeh stir-fry with crunchy veggies
Description: Quick to make, packed with flavor and, thanks to tempeh, full of good plant protein: This tempeh stir-fry is already your new go-to for healthy, colorful, and no-fuss meals. Tempeh is made from soybeans just like tofu, but its fermentation gives it a unique edge, making it firmer in texture, nuttier in taste and even more protein rich. In this recipe, it's fried until crispy, then coated in a glossy sweet-salty sauce that pairs perfectly with those crunchy veggies. The best thing is that you can switch up those veggies depending on the season, your pantry, or simply what you like. Take some broccoli, snow peas, or pak choi; it's all up to you here. Served with fragrant jasmine rice, this stir-fry is truly light yet so satisfying, ideal for any quick lunch or easy dinner day.
Ingredients: 200g tempeh, 200g broccolini, 1 red bell pepper, 2 scallions, 2 cloves garlic, 10g ginger, 1 tbsp starch, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp sweet chili sauce, 4 tbsp water, 75g baby spinach, 2 tbsp sesame oil, sesame seed, jasmine rice, oil
Steps: 1. Cut broccolini into pieces, slice pepper, slice scallions (separate white and green). Chop garlic and ginger. Cut tempeh into pieces, coat with half the cornstarch. 2. Fry tempeh in hot oil until golden. Remove. Saut√© vegetables, scallion whites, garlic and ginger for 3-4 min. 3. Mix soy sauce, sweet chili sauce, remaining cornstarch and water. Add to veggies, simmer briefly. Stir in tempeh and spinach. Season. Drizzle sesame oil, sprinkle scallion greens and sesame seeds. Serve with jasmine rice.
Tags: marinating, weeknight dinner, vegan, salty, spicy, main, veganuary, lactose free, spices, Meatless, Asian, savory, frying, for two, soy products, herbs, vegetables, spring, autumn, summer, winter

Title: Warm bulgur salad with roasted zucchini and radicchio
Description: Let bulgur salad prove itself to be a really cozy dish, and you'll be prepared for any cold day that's coming your way. You'll not only have a cozy autumn Mediterranean meal, but also get a kick of nutritious flavors thanks to the harmony between the zucchini, radicchio, and grapes. Radicchio brings a tart character into this bulgur salad, especially when it's fried in brown butter! It loses most of the bitterness, but rather develops an intense, aromatic flavor. The grapes will be the exciting contrast you need to try this season with the sweet, juicy kick they bring. My two tips are; to lose all the bitterness you can put sliced radicchio in an ice bath for approx. 20 min. before frying, and adding crumbled feta or roasted almond slices to get an even richer taste if you like. This salad will taste the best fresh, but lukewarm or room temperature also works.
Ingredients: 200g bulgur, 400ml water, 2 zucchini, 240g canned chickpeas, 2 cloves garlic, 200g red grapes, 3 tbsp olive oil, 1 radicchio, 40g butter, 40g pine nuts, 10g parsley, 1 lemon, 1 tbsp honey, salt, pepper
Steps: 1. Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/392¬∞F. Cook bulgur in water for 10 min, let rest 5 min. Slice zucchini, rinse chickpeas, chop garlic. Mix zucchini, chickpeas, grapes, garlic, olive oil, salt and pepper. Roast on baking sheet for 20-25 min. 2. Quarter radicchio, remove stalk, cut into pieces. Melt butter until brown, add pine nuts and radicchio, saut√© 1 min. Season and let rest. 3. Chop parsley. Zest and juice lemon. Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, honey, salt and pepper. Mix bulgur, roasted vegetables and radicchio in bowl. Drizzle dressing, add parsley and lemon zest. Serve warm.
Tags: baking, roasting, middle eastern, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, salad, nuts, main, prepare ahead, comfort food, Meatless, savory, fruits, for four, bitter, frying, grains, dairy, herbs, vegetables, autumn, winter, oven, sauteing
